critique: This document is an executive order that allows the House of Representatives' Committee on Public Works to inspect income, estate, or gift tax returns from 1957 to 1965. It is related to an investigation of the Federal-Aid Highway Program. There is nothing to suggest any ideological tilt. The document does not relate to immigration. The order does not expand executive power, but rather enables Congressional oversight. The order does not obviously relate to federalism. The order allows access to tax returns, which could be seen as impinging on privacy, but it is for a specific investigation. The order does not relate to economic regulation. The order does not relate to social inclusion.
